member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.Authentication.ActiveContext
member.summary: Represents a context in which a client is authenticated to dSCM via dSTS. The client is authenticated using an active authentication protocol.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.Authentication.ActiveContext.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Security.Authentication.Contracts.IClientCredential,Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.Authentication.ServiceEnvironment,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The client credential to use for authentication.
The dSCM endpoint against which to authenticate.
The HttpClient to use for network communication with the dSCM service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.Authentication.ActiveContext.#ctor(Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Security.Authentication.Contracts.IClientCredential,System.String,System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The client credential to use for authentication.
The dSCM endpoint against which to authenticate.
The service name component of dSCM's dSTS realm. For example, if the full realm is "svc://dscm@dscm.core.windows.net" then this value would be "dscm".
The HttpClient to use for network communication with the dSCM service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.Authentication.ActiveContext.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.Authentication.ServiceEnvironment,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using Windows Authentication.
member.param: The dSCM endpoint against which to authenticate.
Optional. List of trusted dSTS certificate thumbprints.
Optional. A custom handler for communication with the service.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using certificate-based authentication when the client's home dSTS is the same as the service's.
member.param: The dSCM endpoint against which to authenticate.
The client's X.509 certificate.
ActAs security token
Optional. List of trusted dSTS certificate thumbprints.
Optional. A custom handler for communication with the service.
Optional. Either SubjectNameCredential or CertificateCredential

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using certificate-based authentication when the client's home dSTS differs from the service's home dSTS.
member.param: The dSCM endpoint against which to authenticate.
The client's X.509 certificate.
The client's home dSTS certificate endpoint. eg: https://{dsts dns}/v2/wstrust/13/certificate
ActAs security token
Optional. List of trusted dSTS certificate thumbprints.
Optional. A custom handler for communication with the service.
Optional. Either SubjectNameCredential or CertificateCredential

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using MSI authentication
member.param: The dSCM endpoint against which to authenticate.
Name of the MSI
ActAs security token
Optional. List of trusted dSTS certificate thumbprints.
Optional. A custom handler for communication with the service.

member.summary: For internal use -- prefer other constructors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.IConfigurationRequestProxy.GetPendingApprovalByServiceAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Get configuration requests pending approval by the given service tree id

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Client.IConfigurationRequestProxy.DelegateApprovalAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.Security.ConfigurationManagement.Contracts.DelegatedApprovalStakeholderDetail},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Delegates the configuration request approval to one or more stakeholder services.
member.param: Configuration Request Id.
Approval delgation details.
Service Tree Id of the service that is delegating this approval.

Determines if the delegating service should continue to hold stakeholder rights that allows approval/rejection/approval-delegation of configuration request. If this is set to true, configuration request would require approval from delegating service.
